title: Automated Production Line Workstation Management System
description:
In an automated production line, a system is needed to manage the occupancy status of each workstation to ensure each workstation can be used and released efficiently. The production line has 10 workstations, each numbered from 1 to 10, and each workstation can only handle one workpiece at a time.
Control requirements:
1. The system needs to maintain the occupancy status of the workstations, recording whether each workstation is currently processing a workpiece.
2. When a new workpiece needs processing:
    - Check the occupancy status of the workstations.
    - If there are available workstations, prioritize the workstation with the highest number for processing.
    - If all workstations are occupied, output error status error=1 and error code status=16#8001.
3. When a workpiece is processed:
    - Check the occupancy status of the workstations.
    - If there are workstations processing workpieces, prioritize releasing the workstation with the lowest number.
    - If all workstations are idle, output error status error=1 and error code status=16#8002.
4. The system should be able to output the current number of workpieces being processed and the number of available workstations.
name: LGF_WorkstationManagement

output.name: processingNum
output.description: Current number of workpieces being processed

output.name: error
output.description:
FALSE: No error occurred
TRUE: Error occurred

in/out.name: workstation
in/out.description: Occupancy status of workstations, 1 indicates occupied, 0 indicates available
